metadata.title: CVE-2020-26963 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Repeated calls to the history and location interfaces could have been usedto hang the browser. This was addressed by introducing rate-limiting tothese API calls. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 83.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26963` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
